    • Consider the following HTML

    • Traversing the DOM:

# The DOM:

# Consider the following HTML

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
    <title>Test</title>
    <meta name="description" content="">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="">
    <!-- CSS only -->
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.2.0-beta1/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"
        integrity="sha384-0evHe/X+R7YkIZDRvuzKMRqM+OrBnVFBL6DOitfPri4tjfHxaWutUpFmBp4vmVor" crossorigin="anonymous">
</head>

<body>

    <header id="main-header" class="bg-primary text-white p-4 mb-3">
        <div class="container">

            <h1 id="header-title">Item Lister<span style="display: none">123</span></h1>
        </div>
    </header>
    <div class="container">
        <div id="main" class="card card-body">
            <h2 class="title">Add Item</h2>
            <form class="form mb-3" onsubmit="formSubmit(); return false;">
                <input type="text" class="form-control mr-2">
                <input type="submit" class="btn btn-dark" value="submit">
            </form>

            <h2 class="title">Items</h2>
            <ul id="items" class="list-group">
                <li class="list-group-item">Item 1</li>
                <li class="list-group-item">Item 2</li>
                <li class="list-group-item">Item 3</li>
                <li class="list-group-item">Item 4</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
    </div>

    <script src="./index.js" async defer></script>
    <!-- JavaScript Bundle with Popper -->
    <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.2.0-beta1/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"
        integrity="sha384-pprn3073KE6tl6bjs2QrFaJGz5/SUsLqktiwsUTF55Jfv3qYSDhgCecCxMW52nD2"
        crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
</body>

</html>

# Examine the DOM:

// Examine the DOM

console.log("\n \n \n Examine the DOM \n \n \n");

console.dir(document);
console.log(document.domain);
console.log(document.URL);
console.log(document.title);

document.title = "Todo Page";

console.log(document.doctype);
console.log(document.head);
console.log(document.body);
console.log(document.body.children[0].children[0].children[0].innerHTML);

// document.body.children[0].children[0].children[0].innerHTML = "Hello World!";

console.log(document.forms);
console.log(document.forms[0]);
console.log(document.links);

# DOM Selectors:

// Selectors:

console.log("\n \n \n Selectors in the DOM \n \n \n");

// Get Element by ID
const headerTitle = document.getElementById("header-title");

// Get Element by ID
const headerTitle = document.getElementById("header-title");

// Get Elements by Class Name
let items = document.getElementsByClassName("list-group-item");

// Get Elements by Tag Name
let listItems = document.getElementsByTagName("li");

// Query Selector - Using element ID
let queryHeader = document.querySelector("#main-header");

// Query Selector - Using element tag name:
let queryInput = document.querySelector("input");

// Query Selector - Using element css class:
let queryListItem = document.querySelector(".list-group-item");

# Traversing the DOM:

// Traversing the DOM:
console.log("\n \n \n Traversing the DOM \n \n \n");

let list = document.querySelector("#items");

// Parent Node:
list.parentNode.style.backgroundColor = "lightgrey";
console.log(list.parentNode.parentNode);

// Parent Element:
console.log(list.parentElement.parentElement);

// Child Node: - text is line break
console.log(list.childNodes);

console.log(list.children);
console.log(list.children[1]);

// First Child:
console.log(list.firstChild);
console.log(list.firstElementChild);

// Last Child:
console.log(list.lastChild);
console.log(list.lastElementChild);

# Read HTML DOM Element value:

// Selector to get DOM element:
const headerTitle = document.getElementById("header-title");

// Read textContent
console.log(headerTitle.textContent);

// Read innerText
console.log(headerTitle.innerText);

// Read innerText
console.log(headerTitle.innerHTML);


// Read text input value:
const input = document.querySelector("input");
console.log(input.value);

# Updating the HTML DOM:

// Selector to get DOM element:
const headerTitle = document.getElementById("header-title");

// Update textContent
headerTitle.textContent = "Hello World!";

// Update innerText
headerTitle.innerText = "Goodbye Cruel World!";

// Update innerText
headerTitle.innerHTML = `<em>Test</em>`

// Update element style:
headerTitle.style.fontWeight = "bold";
headerTitle.style.color = "white";
headerTitle.style.backgroundColor = "grey";
headerTitle.style.borderBottom = "solid 3px black";

// Update text input value:
const input = document.querySelector("input");
input.value = 'New input value';

// Update button input value:
const button = document.querySelector("input[type='submit']");
button.value = "ADD ITEM";

# Create HTML DOM Element:

// Create new HTML DOM Element
let newDiv = document.createElement("div");
newDiv.className = "hello";
newDiv.id = "newDiv";
newDiv.setAttribute("title", "myNewDiv");

// Create text node
let textNode = document.createTextNode("My awesome element");
newDiv.appendChild(textNode);

// Insert into HTML DOM
const container = document.querySelector("header .container");
container.appendChild(newDiv);

# Blog App Micro Internship Project Example:

Remove all <li> elements in the <ul> in the HTML file.

In the JS file create an array of objects which represent the blogs posts for your micro-internship-project based on the SPEC in the project brief (to use as "dummy data"). Loop through the each blog post and create and add an <li> element to the order list. Each <li> should display the blog post title, author and date created.

const blogPosts = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: "Javascript fundamentals",
    description: "New Blog post",
    author: " Byron",
    dateCreated: new Date(),
    imgURL:
      "https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/todo-app-a2a71.appspot.com/o/depth-first-search.jpg?alt=media&token=e1dfede8-94f5-48dc-8378-9cccd1431ecb",

// A number of different ways to get the <ul> HTML DOM element
const list1 = document.getElementById("items");
const list2 = document.getElementsByClassName("list-group")[0];
const list3 = document.getElementsByTagName("ul")[0];
const list4 = document.querySelector(".list-group");
const list5 = document.querySelector("#items");
console.log(list1, list2, list3, list4, list5);

for (let post of blogPosts) {
  let newLi = document.createElement("li");
  newLi.className = "list-group-item";

  let text = `${post.title} - Written by ${post.author} on ${post.dateCreated}`;

  let textNode = document.createTextNode(text);
  newLi.appendChild(textNode);

  list1.appendChild(newLi);
}
